subject: Relationships
title: What Narcissism Actually Is
description: A quick win: understand What Narcissism Actually Is.

hook.text: Social media turned 'narcissist' into a casual insult. But clinical narcissism is a specific, measurable disorder.

buildup.text: Narcissistic Personality Disorder affects 1-6% of the population. It involves grandiosity, low empathy, and entitlement.

discovery.text: Behind the grandiose exterior lies fragile self-esteem. Narcissists need constant validation to hold their self-image.

twist.text: Not every selfish person is a narcissist. Overusing the label trivializes real victims of narcissistic abuse.

climax.text: Narcissism exists on a spectrum. Everyone has some traits. The disorder begins when it destroys relationships.

punchline.text: Real narcissism isn't selfishness. It's a disorder that destroys relationships.

quiz.question: What percentage of the population has Narcissistic Personality Disorder?
